Accipiter

NASA scientist finds evidence of alien life - Yahoo! News
 
 It will be interesting to see how this turns out.
 
 What will the creationists say if it is confirmed a bacteria of some kind? (probably something stupid)
 
 There was a news story I ran into about a year ago that said when the Apollo mission went to the moon they brought back pieces of the lunar probes sent before them. They found streptococcus bacteria stuck to some of the parts and astonishingly when the parts warmed up the bacteria were alive. I don't think bacteria floating around out in space takes any stretch of the imagination, they are probably all over the universe. Could life here on earth come from somewhere else? Absolutely.

post_info.post_title: Nasa Scientist Finds Evidence of Alien Life

Stonewall

Definitely interesting, but I don't know how much stock to put into it. It was published in a shady journal and is drawing a lot of criticism/skepticism. I'd love for it to turn out to be true, though. Then maybe we could get some more science funding here in the States.
 
 Here's the actual entry from the guy who found the 'aliens'
 
 Journal of Cosmology
 
 
 Here's the criticism... it seems pretty valid and makes the original claims seem sketchy.
 
 Did scientists discover bacteria in meteorites? : Pharyngula
Freedom

Yea, I was reading an article on this and when the second line said 'an alien life might be much closer to earth life than we thought' I pretty much lost hope.
 
 The chances are much higher that someone is mistaking earth species for aliens than aliens look like earth species in my opinion.
Penfold
Let's not entirely discount the possibility that Earth species are originally Alien species who stayed on.

Let's not entirely discount the possibility that Earth species are originally Alien species who stayed on.

 Indeed that did cross my mind, but I think that one of the main points is that the meteor is only 150 years old max. Now that doesn't mean that the same bacteria wouldn't be around as billions of years ago as space is pretty static place, but if that was indeed the case I wonder how one would go about proving the species is in fact alien when by that theory the chemical basis would be about the same.
